hopobject.name: Page
hopobject.body: How long are you planning to stay here? geneticdrugs.de That's solid logic. But this isn't the first stab at harvesting papillae to grow new human hair — in fact, researches have known for more than 40 years that you can harvest rodent papilla cells, expand their numbers in a petri dish, and transplant them back to get newly grown rodent hair. That technique has never worked with human papillae: When cultured in a petri dish, the human cells lost their ability to form new hair follicles.
